channel.title: Monitor not working after
channel.description: Hi, I was setting up one of my other computers yesterday and it worked fine about a week and a half ago but was very slow because it only had 128MB of RAM so I threw the other Stick of PC133 128MB I have in there before I set it up. I then turned it only and the monitor didn't work. So I hooked up two other monitors and they didn't work on it either. I was wondering if the problem could be one of the sticks of ram. They're both PC133 and both 128MB sticks of RAM. Any input would be appreciated. Thanks.

item.title: Monitor not working after
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

If you have an IGP (onboard gfx), then you might have RAM sharing enabled (sharing RAM with video RAM).
Maybe the BIOS got confused or something from the new RAM. Maybe the second one you put in is really old? Try switching the RAMs (slot 1 to 2, and 2 to 1). If that doesn’t work try to disable RAM sharing.

(This is all based on the assumption that you have sharing enabled :P)

Read full topic

item.title: Monitor not working after
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

nah its just a crappy old HP w/o a video card and the monitor doesn’t show up at all so I can’t check the drivers yet. I’ll just have to remove the ram in a few minutes and see if that helps.

Read full topic

item.title: Monitor not working after
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Make sure you have your video driver’s installed, and if you have a video card make sure the monitor is plugged into the vid card and not the motherboard.

Read full topic

item.title: Monitor not working after
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:2, topic:22524”]Make sure your monitors are plugged in properly and there not damaged, else make sure the monitor plug is fully functioning.

Or remove the ram you installed.[/quote]
the monitors work but i havent got around to removing the ram yet. I just hope its not my mobo thats messed up.

Read full topic

item.title: Monitor not working after
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Make sure your monitors are plugged in properly and there not damaged, else make sure the monitor plug is fully functioning.

Or remove the ram you installed.

Read full topic
